column2: Three of the seven gables either fronted or looked sideways, with a dark solemnity of aspect, down into the garden.

column2: The black, rich soil had fed itself with the decay of a long period of time; such as fallen leaves, the petals of flowers, and the stalks and seed--vessels of vagrant and lawless plants, more useful after their death than ever while flaunting in the sun.

column2: The remainder of the garden presented a well-selected assortment of esculent vegetables, in a praiseworthy state of advancement.

column2: Summer squashes almost in their golden blossom; cucumbers, now evincing a tendency to spread away from the main stock, and ramble far and wide; two or three rows of string-beans and as many more that were about to festoon themselves on poles; tomatoes, occupying a site so sheltered and sunny that the plants were already gigantic, and promised an early and abundant harvest.

column3: No, child! replied Hepzibah.

column2: Fewer words than before, but with the same mysterious music in them! Mellow, melancholy, yet not mournful, the tone seemed to gush up out of the deep well of Hepzibah's heart, all steeped in its profoundest emotion.
column3: Fewer words than before, but with the same mysterious music in them! Mellow, melancholy, yet not mournful, the tone seemed to gush up out of the deep well of Hepzibah's heart, all steeped in its profoundest emotion.

column2: There was a tremor in it, too, that--as all strong feeling is electric--partly communicated itself to Phoebe.
column3: There was a tremor in it, too, that-as all strong feeling is electric-partly communicated itself to Phoebe.

column2: The girl sat silently for a moment.
column3: The girl sat silently for a moment.

column2: But soon, her senses being very acute, she became conscious of an irregular respiration in an obscure corner of the room. Her physical organization, moreover, being at once delicate and healthy, gave her a perception, operating with almost the effect of a spiritual medium, that somebody was near at hand.
column3: But soon, her senses being very acute, she became conscious of an irregular respiration in an obscure corner of the room. Her physical organization, moreover, being at once delicate and healthy, gave her a perception, operating with almost the effect of a spiritual medium, that somebody was near at hand.

column2: My dear cousin, asked she, overcoming an indefinable reluctance, "is there not some one in the room with us?"
column3: My dear cousin, asked she, overcoming an indefinable reluctance, "is there not some one in the room with us?"

column2: Phoebe, my dear little girl, said Hepzibah, after a moment's pause, "you were up betimes, and have been busy all day.
column3: Phoebe, my dear little girl, said Hepzibah, after a moment's pause, "you were up betimes, and have been busy all day.

column2: Pray go to bed; for I am sure you must need rest.
column3: Pray go to bed; for I am sure you must need rest.

column2: I will sit in the parlor awhile, and collect my thoughts.
column3: I will sit in the parlor awhile, and collect my thoughts.

column2: It has been my custom for more years, child, than you have lived!" While thus dismissing her, the maiden lady stept forward, kissed Phoebe, and pressed her to her heart, which beat against the girl's bosom with a strong, high, and tumultuous swell. How came there to be so much love in this desolate old heart, that it could afford to well over thus abundantly?
column3: It has been my custom for more years, child, than you have lived!" While thus dismissing her, the maiden lady stept forward, kissed Phoebe, and pressed her to her heart, which beat against the girl's bosom with a strong, high, and tumultuous swell. How came there to be so much love in this desolate old heart, that it could afford to well over thus abundantly?

column2: Goodnight, cousin, said Phoebe, strangely affected by Hepzibah's manner.
column3: Goodnight, cousin, said Phoebe, strangely affected by Hepzibah's manner.

column2: If you begin to love me, I am glad!
column3: If you begin to love me, I am glad!

column2: She retired to her chamber, but did not soon fall asleep, nor then very profoundly.
column3: She retired to her chamber, but did not soon fall asleep, nor then very profoundly.
